Floor 4893: <radio crackles to life>Milan Center  Speedbird 551 requesting FL410 to avoid the experimental on the runway.

Milan Center: Speedbird 551 climb and maintain FL410.

Floor 4894: 6 Kerbals on a runway, 5 watching as the 6th takes off for a test run in their first plane.

Floor 4895: a sim pilot giggling at DIPIR (say Diaper)

034205152024
Floor 4896: 7 Kerbals discussing if it would be possible to leave the atmosphere.

Floor 4897: vacuum chambers

041605152024
Floor 4898: 8 Kerbals working on a pressurised capsule.

Floor 4899: a barrel of “DIP” 

Spoiler

055905152024

Floor 4900: A giant celebration commemorating KSP1 and the communtity it has spawned. Remembering 5 good things for every 1 that went wrong. How creating an open and straight forward system allowed people who had never even thought that they might be able to contribute and add to a game, made it possible for them to make it even richer. How treating customers as partners, not cash cows, made it what it is today.

Floor 4901: You are unable to enter. The door just leads to a wall of paper. You forcefully extract an excerpt from the paper wall. It appears to be a list of KSP 1 bug reports that were more than five years old in 2021 and remained unfixed.

 

You hope whoever compiled the list is not buried inside this room.
Floor 4902: A reminder that even if official development on KSP 2 stops, people will just make their own mods to finish the game.
Floor 4903: 9 Kerbals working on Solid Fuel Boosters.

Floor 4904: a sentence with over one hundred thousand items separated by commas just for you Floor 4903. The list ends: …, and the next floor is: Floor 4910.

092305152024
Floor 4905: 10 Kerbals working out a Reaction Control System.
Floor 4906: 11 Kerbals playing cards inside a large hydrogen fuel tank.

Floor 4911: 23 Kerbals upsetting up a command edge.
Floor 4912: 14 Kerbals putting together various parts that other Kerbals have been working on, to make a working orbiter.
Floor 4913: 93 previous orbiters occupying the orbit.
